text:
Listing 7.36: Example output from using a Multi-headed MLP to forecast a dependent time
series.
7.3.2 Multiple Parallel Series
An alternate time series problem is the case where there are multiple parallel time series and a
value must be predicted for each. For example, given the data from the previous section:
[[ 10 15 25]
[ 20 25 45]
[ 30 35 65]
[ 40 45 85]
[ 50 55 105]
[ 60 65 125]
[ 70 75 145]
[ 80 85 165]
[ 90 95 185]]
